The additional onions, tomato, and lettuce were also very fresh and added some good brightness to a heavy dish. The sides were sweet potato chips and a pearl couscous pesto salad. Neither of the sides really blew me away, but I had more than enough sandwich to satisfy. 

The service here was efficient and very friendly. Even with the tiny water cups the server managed to keep quite a few crowded tables well quenched. 

This spot is worth venturing out to. I definitely would like to return here for the $10 lunch deal or for happy hour to try some of their other offerings and some of their signature cocktails.

Think meetings suck?
Think they're not productive?
Yelp Elite Rowan C is queen of awesome meetings, seriously, we get so much done and have a great time gabbing.
When she heard I had never been to Liliana's she decided a mid-week visit was a must! We decided to split a french press which was decent, but the temperature of the water wasn't hot enough and I'm guessing the grounds were a little too fine because many made it to my mug and created a pretty bitter sludge. The bananas foster fared a bit better, although sort of a small portion for eight bucks. Rowan's pecan pie was tasty, albeit a touch on the sweet side. (I realize pecan pie is essentially nuts/crust/sugar/egg...sweet...but a dash of salt of something spicy like nutmeg or ginger can really cut the cloyingly sweet taste that lingers.) I want to head back and check this place out for a more substantial meal but I'd probably pass on dessert.

We've lived near here for 18 months and have never gone in. To be honest we didn't even know what kind of food they served until recently. 

So Fat Tuesday rolls around and we decide we'll go to the cajun/creole place down the street, and what a surprise! The interior is very nice, there was a live band and the food and drinks were great! 

We both had the tomato basil soup---definitely rich and seemed to be made with quality ingredients. Then we had the cajun cheese curds----some of the best we've had in Madison (and that's saying something). 

For the main course we split the Jambalaya. This was our only disappointtment. We asked for it to be extra spicy---and found it to be barely spicy at all. But spice can be a hard thing to rate and we both love spicy food so we aren't the best judges. There also wasn't much rice in the jambalaya----which most people probably prefer. But there was TONS of meat---shrimp, bacon, sausage, etc.. 

The cocktails were also fun. My husband tried the traditional Sezerac and I had the Pimm's Cup. Both good! We plan to go back and give it another go with the spice-factor.

We just had a large work party here for lunch, and many people commented on how much they like the food.  Service was a little slow but, we were a big group.  They had run out of a few lunch special menu items, that was a little disappointing.

Ok, time to update my review of what was once my favorite restaurant. Unfortunately it has taken a turn for the worse. Now, don't get me wrong. The food is still great, but we have had some pretty bad service the last couple of times we've been there.

The last time was three weeks ago, for Sunday brunch. It wasn't terribly busy, with lots of empty tables. We were in a group of ten,  with six adults and four kids, including a two year old. 

We ordered drinks, appetizers and main courses. It was a speedy brunch.

We ordered several bottomless French press coffees, bottomless mimosas. Getting them refilled was like pulling teeth. Even our water glasses ran dry. 


The food took a very long time to arrive. When it did, the kid's meals came out last. 

When the appetizers came out, we asked for some refills and a few additional beverages for the kids. It took a while but eventually we got the refills, but then after the food arrived we had to remind her about the kids drinks.

The waitress did not stop by to ask how we liked our food. (It was delicious, if delayed.) Had she done so we could have used the opportunity to get some drink refills.  Our dinner companions even commented somewhat loudly how great it would be if they could get some more coffee while they he waitress was in earshot. Nothing.

In the end, we got our bills (one for each of the three families at our table) and found that we had each been charged a 20% gratuity.

Things seem to be a bit more hit or miss at Lilliana's. The experience we used to have and rave about seems to only occur when Chef Dave is there. Unfortunately that is a lot less often than it used to be.

Have been two times and it was really good both times. The Diablo chicken was very very tasty and the cornbread appetizer was awesome. Their cheese curds are really good; I would compare them to the old fashioned. Ambiance was a little weird, I felt like they were trying to be too swanky, but maybe I just prefer more casual down n dirty Cajun places. 

Good for groups too. Went with a party of six or seven and didn't even have to wait for a table.

It was pointed out to me, as I was talking about how bad the last few trips were, that I still had this at 5 stars.

The spectacular service that I had been used to has gone away.  The service for the last 3-4 visits was bad at best.  The food seems to have suffered as well; little things being missed, degradation of quality and consistency.

To be truthful, I am not sure I'll ever be back at this point.  I have been frequenting a better Cajun place in the area and they are more personable and take a higher level of pride in their food.  Not to mention they are way less expensive.

The food was really good.  My husband had the Bouillabasse and he thought it was excellent.  I had the shrimp scampi and I enjoyed the different seafood as well as the sauce had a little spice (which I liked).  The kid's mac n cheese was good too.  We had some raw oysters and the waiter Brian helped us pick 3 different kinds to try.  It was Sunday night family night so our daughter ate for free and they had $4 Sangrias which were good.  We decided to have dessert, the creme brulee was great and the chocolate mousse was excellent.  It was not a cheap meal but we thought the price was good for all of the courses we had.  We sat outside which was really nice.  We will be back.

This restaurant is nice. Live music, good wine list, food is pretty good. I had the Louisiana pasta. I wasn't extremely blown away but it was pretty good. The beignets are of course amazing. Service is good. You can tell the servers are trained well. 

Negative points for Best of Madison being thrown in your face everywhere you go. Sign in front grass, sign in the foyer when you come in, sign in the bathroom, sign on the menu, all begging for votes. Does it really count if you are doing that? Super tacky in my opinion. 

I would normally give a 4 because it was good but I wasn't blown away, but am giving 3 stars for the tacky Best of Madison everywhere.

I wasn't blown away. I had a tap beer, which was fine,  but this definitely wasn't New Orleans Cajun. The corn bread and jalapeno butter was tasty, but the crab cake was mushy (more bread than crab) and didn't have a great flavor. I had Liliana's pasta, which was pretty bland. It needed a little more sauce, and I had to give it a healthy dose of salt and pepper to bring it to life. In spite of this, the service was solid and I enjoyed the live music. Bottom line, I probably won't go back next time I'm in the area, as nothing stood out in terms of the food.

So delicious and lots of good options. The appetizers are varied and well-portioned. The sandwiches are so good and the entrees range from reasonably healthy to downright indulgent. The live music is just the cherry on top!

My husband just took me to Liliana's this past Sunday for my golden birthday! (I turned 28 on the 28th :) It was so great. A few years ago, we went to New Orleans and I had a very difficult time finding things to eat that weren't covered in slabs of oil and bread crumbs, so finding a cajun place with a fantastic vegetarian/vegan selection sent me over the moon.

On a Sunday night right after Christmas, it was pretty empty, but a friend said it's usually packed. Our service was just okay -- our appetizer was obviously forgotten and came out with our food and getting to us initially took a while. But they made up for it with a free dessert and champagne!

I had the mushroom po' boy without blue cheese (provolone instead) that also came with a white bean salad and these beautiful, delicate sweet potato swirls. They were so fresh and light, I LOVED them. The white bean salad was also excellent and I wish I could get a scoop of it for work! The sandwich was tasty, especially with the crispy bread, though I think the flavor was a little muted for me since I got provolone instead. It was missing something to give it a special kick ... but I truly despise blue cheese.

We ordered the veggie tots for an appetizer, but they came with the meal. We also didn't get the corn bread & jalapeno butter until the meal. Both were SO yummy.

For dessert, they came us a free creme brulee, and then we ordered the almond cake to take home.

The part that impressed me the most was after all of that food, I didn't feel overly full or gross. I felt like I could run around the parking lot even! It wasn't that portions were insanely small or anything, either. Everything just tasted fresh and like the chef really knows how to balance spices and fried stuff.

Can't wait to go back!

First time. Went for brunch but I definitely want to come back for that truffle lobster Mac and cheese. Arrived right at 10am. Started filling up about the time we left and that was around 11am. 

Decor is really nice. Very clean and bright. The tables were decorated with a bright flower and candle. 

I ordered the crab cake Benedict and my wife had the Liliana breakfast. Also ordered some beignets and some colorful drinks. Delicious drinks. Brunch was very good!!

I really wanted to like this place! They have many vegetarian and vegan options, and live music adds to a fun ambiance. Unfortunately the tofu was not well seasoned or cooked, and when my friend said as much to our server Bryan, he rudely replied "yeah I would never order that." And "it's tofu, that's pretty much as good as it gets." No apology, just attitude. Sorry Bryan, I can make better tofu at home and will next time I'm thinking of coming to Liliana's.

Have eaten here on multiple occasions in the past year when traveling for work. Tried the Jambalaya to go (see my original photo) and on my next trip hit up the bar for some Abita on draft and an excellent Blackened Catfish.  The dish's presentation was a welcome surprise and added to the taste as the drizzled on red paste wasn't just for looks but was a spicy creole meuniere.

I really enjoy this restaurant.  The hurricanes are really good.  The food is flavorful.  I really really love the shrimp and grits.  If I lived closer to Fitchburg, I would go once a month on top of the 4-5 times a year I already go.

I recommend this fun spot off of Hwy PD.
Pretty good Cajun food. They can make a good drink. Their menu is standard Cajun. The beignets are amazing!! Still Id go to Louisiana's Etc in Middleton.

So my boyfriend ordered the salmon and really liked it, I ordered the fried shrimp po boy and HATED it. Omg it was nasty, everything that was on my plate was no good. I'm very picky so i tried going with something that I was familiar with... The fried shrimp were barely fried, shouldn't have even called them that and they were VERY rubbery.. On top of that they were massive. I mean the shrimp were huge.. So just imagine taking a bite into a sandwich and eating a half fried giant rubber shrimp. I couldn't even eat it. I moved on to the chips hoping i could eat something on the plate, but no. They were chewy?! Why? Maybe that's how they were suppose to be and I'm just so out of tune with what's going on.. But I didn't eat those either. My boyfriend did however because the small portion of salmon on his plate left him still hungry. You think for $18 you'd be able to get full. Anyways I'm not going back just off that one experience. I think I'll pass. Out was that bad. For the price (expensive) I should have loved everything. Oh yea we also had the cheese curds, once again disappointed. Greasy and no flavor. I love cheese curds and being from Wisconsin I know a good one when I eat it and they definitely weren't up to par. I'll pass

Very salty. I was here 3 years ago and the food was good. However, I was very disappointed about tonight. The scallops were fishy and the risotto was extremely salty. I asked someone from the party to try my risotto and she said "omg that is nothing compared how salty my jambalaya is". 
The service was also just okay. I will be going to downtown Madison next time. This place has taken a big dive!
The waitress greeted us promptly. The food was very delicious! Corn bread was awesome! The best jambalaya I have ever had! I also had endive salad, which came in huge portion.

April 2014 - The concept is great, the food was adequate, the service was flat.   I called for dress code advice and reservations and informed the employee that it would be our first visit to Liliana's and our party of four were celebrating my boyfriend's birthday.  When I arrived at the restaurant I handed the hostess my credit card so that I could pay for the meal and again advised of the birthday celebration.   She seated us near the table bussing station in an nearly empty dining room.  The waiter was not engaged, the restaurant was out of Albita Lite beer,  one of us ordered the catfish po-boy and she received the catfish dinner, another ordered the steak medium and it arrived red in the middle.  My dish (Diablo Chicken) was not spicy at all and when I asked for more Sirachi sauce, he brought the sauce that was already on the chicken.  We had research the menu online and when we asked about hush puppies the waiter informed us the menu changes all the time and hush puppies were not available.  The cornbread was delicious, the pear salad was very good and the beignets were wonderful.  The hostess either did not convey to the waiter my payment request nor the birthday celebration or the waiter did not bother to comply with either.  

All in all it was a disappointment, the birthday boy did enjoy his jambalaya.

Not sure if were will be back.

First off I love Cajun food and the Louisiana culture! We had high hopes for this place however we left before we could taste their food. There was no hostess available to seat us. The owner eventually came out after people started lining up by the door...20 minutes later!  Right away there was a long black hair on the napkin which I pointed out. Owners sarcastic joke was that the hair was free of charge. Haha I wasn't amused after the long wait. Half and hour later waitress came to take our drink orders. We asked for water and their wine list. We left several minutes later because she never returned. It was a waste of an hour.

Snagged 2 seats at bar for Fat Tuesday. Bartenders were super helpful and friendly. Had a drink and somehow allowed myself to be talked into the pound cake over the beignets. Kind of disappointing--dry and bland with 4 sad blueberries. Music was just not very festive--rather off for far Tuesday.

I came here one Sunday morning for the brunch. First of all, the atmosphere and the interior of the restaurant is very good. 

Cornbread was served while waiting. It's very tasty and sweet.
I tried the jambalaya scramble. The sauce was well-flavored. And the potatoes were crispy on the outside and delicious.

My favorite part was probably a man playing lovely songs with the guitar, which made us an even better and relaxing dining experience.

A cute and fancy piece of Nawlins nestled in the outskirts of Madison, WI. Inside is decked out with Mardi Gras masks and lots of Fleur de Lis. The dining room was reminiscent of the Quarter with a working fountain and a Bourbon St style balcony. Service and the food were just ok. I understand that this is Wisconsin, not New Orleans, LA, but if you're serving food and calling it cajun, you need to come correct. (They came a lil sideways...maybe zigzag.)

KOREAN BBQ SEITAN:
$16 - Came with 2 round patties (think Salisbury steak), complete with grill marks. I tasted zero remnants of BBQ, so I'm unsure why that was part of the name. I wasn't bad, but it wasn't necessarily good either; I couldn't quite figure it out. It was interesting. However, the sweet potato puree and charred asparagus, which was hiding underneath the seitan patties, were both delicious! I could've used more of both and would've been satisfied with this dish. Vegan

RED BEANS & RICE (vegan version):
$15 - It looked great. It smelled great, yet the delivery fell short. It had a distinct sweetness to it, but no spice, little flavor, and no cajun soul. I doused it in some of their homemade hot sauces, but I couldn't save this dish. Oh, the possibilities. *insert sad face* And I have to admit, I was a little jealous of my friend's cornbread with jalapeño butter. Neither was vegan, so I couldn't eat it, but it made me really want a vegan version, which would go perfectly with some good, vegan red beans & rice.

CHOCOLATE CAKE:
$6 - A vegan and gluten free piece of chocolate cake with chlocolate and raspberry drizzle. I appreciate that they even offer a vegan dessert at a non-veg restaurant, but it wasn't anything to write home about. It was ok though. 

Like with the dessert, I love that they are so vegan friendly, but everything I ordered just didn't live up to its potential or expectation.  Even the hot tea was generic; I'd have been better off at Starbucks. Based on my experience, I wouldn't go out of my way to return, but I recommend that you at least try it for yourself.

This is a dynamite spot for Brunch. Bottomless mimosas are tasty and the refills come quick. I ordered the crab cake Benedict and my date ordered the breakfast sandwich. Both were absolutely delicious. Sometimes in the Midwest crab cakes can be suspect but have no fear they do it right! A generous helping of crab is in each cake. 

A very nice touch was the pastry included before the meal came out to eat with coffee. A must try for Creole or Cajun fans.
Great vegan options, though a little pricey.  Worth the trip.  Fancy interior with live music, and the outside is nice too though one side is definitely nicer.

Went during restaurant week - we are moving to Fitchburg and hoped to find a good neighborhood restaurant. Firstly all the staff seemed harassed - we had made reservations and  the hostess asked us did we understand it was restaurant week. we replied yes and she seemed relieved. The place looked fairly nice. It took us 20 mins to get drinks - 2 1/2 hours later to get an entire 3 course set menu, with 3 or 4 set 3 course meals varying by around $5 a time, no regular menu in service.

We asked could we swap anything - the server said no. She didn't' ask what we wanted, all we wanted was to each have a cup of vegetarian gumbo as a starter, which would have been easier for them and certainly cost less to them. failed restaurant test one, and while we expect reasonable accommodation of reasonable requests we do understand things in restaurant week, but since she never asked want we wanted, she just said no - fail.

The bus boy while filling the glasses said they'd been rushed, the place was half empty. We heard several other nearby tables complain about service. 

Food was meh - my entree was cold - steak and cheese grits and or polenta - or cheese polenta, yes it was that memorable, not. Rice in the gumbo was hard. 

Wine at $13 a glass - tiny pours - server was "snooty" re wine - i asked a question, my wife asked for a glass of Malbec, for some reason the wine list seemed hard for them to find - I asked was it an Argentinian Malbec or French (thinking perhaps French because it's a Cajun Restaurant, my wife has a I dunno she doesn't like French wine), server had no idea and looked at me as if i was speaking Klingon, yet had been ready to lecture us on wine. 

We moved to Madison 2 years ago after 15 years in Atlanta and Chicago - this is was the worst overall restaurant experience we've had in the Madison area in those 2 years and while the bill for 2 people and a couple of drinks wasn't abnormal for a major city - $150 for amateur hour doesn't cut it - 

We had two other meals at our regular spots in Madison proper during restaurant week, and both establishments while much busier than Liliana's were heads and shoulder's better experiences - in fact I'd wanted to leave as it didn't look like it would end well from the start but my wife had a 6am flight the next day and wanted to eat and not go off looking for somewhere else. We'll not be back and when we move just drive another 5 mins for Madison dining - if your restaurant can't handle restaurant week probably best to just close it that week. Just to add I own a restaurant - in a major city - and many of my friends own or manage restaurants, Chicago or Atlanta -   Sad!.

I'm conflicted. I enjoyed my meal at Liliana's. The rest of my party was a tad less enthusiastic. But this is my review, right? Right. So it gets a three.

The atmosphere of the restaurant is fun! It's classy, yet playfully New Orleans-like. There were cool lights representing street lamps of sorts, which lined the walkway/hallway to more seating that I found cool, plus a fountatin that was adjacent to the table we were at. First impressions: great. 

As far as food goes....three cheers for the complimentary cornbread! I LOVE cornbread and theirs was served nice and toasty warm with a jalapeno butter and it was all glorious. 

As I hysterically raved about the cornbread, we ordered calamari (of course) as an appetizer and while fried calamari is not my personal favorite, this dish was polished off by everyone else.


For entrees, we ordered:

*jambalya of blackened shrimp, andouille sausage, taso ham, nueske's bacon, peppers, tomatoes, onions, rice

*pasta liliana - shrimp, andouille, chicken, parpadelle pasta, spicy red pepper cream sauce

*pork tenderloin special

*scottish salmon, red pepper risotto, julienned squash, balsamic reduction, chive oil

*caesar salad


The jambalya was tasty though I feel unworthy of bashing/bolstering this dish as jambalya is uncharted territory for me. Truthfully, I'd say this was only my second experience with jambalya. Soooo I'm far from an expert on the dish. But I did enjoy it. I appreciated how the various ingredients/components worked together and complimented one another.

The pasta dish got the thumbs up. 

The pork tenderloin special, on the other hand, was mediocre. The pork was rather tough and overcooked. And the dish as a whole just had too much going on that it wasn't a cohesive entrée. The flavors were all over the place, not in a good way.

The salmon that I ordered as my meal was very tasty. The fish and risotto were both cooked just right and seasoned perfectly. 

Overall, I'm glad I tried Liliana's....and man am I craving that cornbread right about now.

2 Stars is for this particular night's server, not the food- which is always excellent.

We live near Liliana's and have been here multiple times.  The food is ALWAYS excellent.  Last night we were there with a group of 6.  We ordered 3 appetizers.  3 of us ordered salads.  All of us ordered entrees. When the salads came, one was a half and two were whole.  The half was huge and the whole could feed an army. A large army. When two if us said that we hadn't wanted that large a salad, the server said, "the menu says half and whole." I said, "Then you should ask us whether we want half or whole".  She said, "If you don't say, we give you a whole."  I said, "Then you should change that and ask." And they should.  When a server is snotty with you, it colors the experience. (BTW, we heard a different server explain the salad size difference to a neighboring table, so we know it is not Liliana's policy.)

Several of us had the short ribs- and as usual- EXCELLENT!

We will be back, but really Liliana's, train your servers in this area. Ridiculous.

Went here last Friday.  I had the fried shrimp po boy, which was awesome.  My wife had the mac and cheese which was also really good.  The only issue is the food takes a long time to get to your table and it wasn't very busy when we got there as we went at 5:30pm.  Kitchen is slow, but the food is great.
Love that they have excellent vegan options. I really like the vegan red beans and also the Seitan. Nice drink menu and friendly bartenders and servers.

I had the jambalaya and it was very good. GF had the fish and pasta, she loved it. Only problem was that we sat outside and a bee was bothering us.

otherwise the drinks are great, the food was plentiful, and the atmosphere was very calm!

We didn't visit this restaurant in our own backyard for months because my partner "doesn't like Cajun food". He's a convert. Every dish we tried was delicious without tasting overly fatty: spicy without being unpleasantly hot. Dave is a food genius! Try the beignets with the chocolate mousse (cut them in half and stuff in the mousse!) and the tomato bisque. We did not try the jambalaya this time but the etouffee was excellent.

I enjoyed Liliana's much more than I was expecting. I came at 5:30 on a Saturday night, and, though I did have a reservation, there were still many open tables. I ordered the truffled endive salad and a bowl of the gumbo. Both were delicious. The salad was presented nicely and the portion was not too large or too small. The gumbo was very hearty and had an earthy, smokey touch- not to mention it was a tad spicy!

The decor was a perfect combination of classy and festive.  When the jazz pianist started playing later that night, I would have sworn I was actually in New Orleans. (A glace out the window to falling snow quickly diminished that notion...) Liliana's has a very comfortable atmosphere and it would be an easy place to sit for hours and talk your life away, or dream of the too-far-away Cajun country. This is perhaps the first restaurant that has won me over for its ambiance before its food.

All in all, a solid choice for a great night out!

I wanted to give Liliana's a 5-star review because the food was very good. But we were overcharged at the restaurant (charged for two appetizers instead of one). When we called and spoke with the waitress, she assured us she would credit back our card. She never did that. Then I reached out to them on their website to let them know of the oversight. They never responded to me. Horrible customer service - good food.
